meanings.sent1: She enjoys impainting colorful designs on her bedroom walls.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully impaints the canvas with vibrant hues.
meanings.sent3: The children were impainting their faces with finger paints for the school play.
meanings.sent4: The sun impaints the sky with shades of pink and orange during sunset.
meanings.sent5: The skilled painter impaints the old fence, transforming it into a work of art.

meanings.definition: To decorate or adorn with paint
meanings.sent1: He decided to impaint the wooden chair with a fresh coat of white paint.
meanings.sent2: The students worked together to impaint the classroom walls for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally impainted its paws while walking through wet paint.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter impainted the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The mural impaints the entire building, making it a colorful landmark in the city.

meanings.definition: The act of painting or decorating with paint
meanings.sent1: Impainting requires patience and precision to achieve the desired result.
meanings.sent2: The impainting of the house was completed just in time for the family reunion.
meanings.sent3: The impainting of the school walls brought a sense of unity among the students.
meanings.sent4: His impainting of the landscape captured the beauty of nature in every stroke.
meanings.sent5: The impainting of the car gave it a fresh new look, attracting admiring glances.
